questions.question: I would rather consult a doctor than ................................ in fear.
questions.description: Would rather is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I can't help ................................... about her.
questions.description:
If you say that you can’t help doing something, you mean that you can’t stop yourself from doing it. 
In this structure we use an ing form after help.

questions.question: I couldn't help ................................... those cookies.
questions.description:
If you say that you can’t help doing something, you mean that you can’t stop yourself from doing it. 
In this structure we use an ing form after help.

questions.question: She is busy ................................. ready for work.
questions.description: The structure I am busy is followed by an –ing form.

questions.question: Brother is busy ...................................... his studies.
questions.description: Instead of an –ing form, we can use with + noun after I’m busy.

questions.question: I am looking forward .................................. Paris.
questions.description: Look forward to / Looking forward to is followed by an ing form or a noun.

questions.question: I will help you ....................................... the cleaning.
questions.description: Before a noun we use help with.

questions.question: Can you help me ....................................... my keys?
questions.description: Help can be followed by object + infinitive with or without to.

questions.question: It is your turn .................................... the dishes.
questions.description: An infinitive with to is used in this structure.

questions.question: I am having a hard time ..................................... a good job.
questions.description: An ing form is used in this structure.

questions.question: You had better ..................................... me my money back.
questions.description: After had better the infinitive is used without to.
